H0.text: Drawing a picture is the best way to communicate the results of the investigation in which students measured plant growth at the end of two weeks to determine how sunlight affects the speed of plant growth.

H1.text: Making notes is the best way to communicate the results of an investigation in which students measure the growth of a plant at the end of two weeks to determine how sunlight affects the speed of plant growth.

H2.text: Making a chart or graph is the best way to communicate the results of students’ investigation measuring how sunlight affects the speed of plant growth over a two‑week period.

H3.text: Telling the science teacher is the best way to communicate the results of the investigation in which students measured plant growth after two weeks to see how sunlight affects the speed of plant growth.

A4.text: Typically the data in a chart is represented graphically since humans can infer meaning from pictures more quickly than from text.

A5.text: Charts can usually be read more quickly than the raw data.
